de.affect.appraisal.eec

Class Appealingness

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.appraisal.eec.Appealingness

  • public class Appealingness
extends java.lang.Object
    The Appealingness class represents the appealingness of an object. The appealingness of an object is evaluated with respect to an character's attitudes.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Martin Klesen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Appealingness(double degree)
      Returns a new Appealingness object using the specified value to describe the degree of appealingness.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double absDegree()
      Returns the absolut degree of appealingness.
      double degree()
      Returns the degree of appealingness.
      boolean isAppealing()
      Returns true if the object is appealing and false if it is unappealing.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string describing the appealingness.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Appealingness

        public Appealingness(double degree)
        Returns a new Appealingness object using the specified value to describe the degree of appealingness.
        Parameters:
        degree - the degree of appealingness. A negative degree denotes unapealingness.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the degree is not a real number in the interval [-1.0,1.0].
